episodes.title: Protest LIVE: Scientology's anti-psychiatry front group CCHR 'Industry of Death'
episodes.description:
Don't fall for their lies, it's a cult in disguise! Scientology’a anti-psychiatry front group, the 'Citizens Commission on Human Rights' have set up a pop-up 'Industry of Death' museum in Chelsea. There is no mention of its links to Scientology whatsoever on the store frontage, signage or promotional materials so we wanted to make sure passers by were fully informed before handing over any of their personal information.

The exhibition took place 21st - 29th September at the £1,600-per-day pop-up venue, 81 King's Road.

Please be sure to subscribe to @PerthScientologyAudit and @SPCrusader, who joined me at today's protest.. thank you!

episodes.title: Scientology's hotels of darkness: Live with Danish activist Robert Dam
episodes.description:
Robert Dam spent 20 years working for Scientology at their European headquarters in Copenhagen, Denmark before escaping in 2004. In 2011, his book 'The Defector' became a hard-hitting bestseller and now, his new book 'Mørkets Hoteller' ("Hotels of Darkness") details the high price children must pay when raised in Scientology.

Join us to discuss his activism and how his book created to a media storm which led to the Danish Parliament recently scheduling a debate on Scientology's abusive practices.

Hotels of Darkness (Danish): https://www.williamdam.dk/moerkets-hoteller__3812787
The Defector (English): https://www.amazon.co.uk/DEFECTOR-After-20-years-Scientology-ebook/dp/B01N4QV7ZK

episodes.title: Maiden Voyage: Life at sea with Scientology founder L. Ron Hubbard - live with Janis Gilham-Grady
episodes.description:
On June 6th, 1988 the Church of Scientology christened the motor yacht Freewinds. The date is celebrated every year with an international summit hosted by David Miscavige known as the 'Maiden Voyage' event.

Janis Gilham-Grady, who previously served as one of L. Ron Hubbard's first 'Commodore's Messengers' aboard the flagship Apollo, was on the Freewinds when it set sail in 1988. Join me as we discuss the historic event and what life was like working with Hubbard at sea.

episodes.title: Potential Trouble Source: Why I joined Scientology, and how I became their worst nightmare
episodes.description:
How could anybody join a cult? And how did I go from being Scientology's top recruiter to their number one UK problem?

On March 25th, I gave a talk to about 40 members of the public at the Nightingale Room in Brighton as a guest speaker for the critical thinking group 'Brighthink'. The talk explores my state of mind when I joined Scientology as a teenager in more detail than I've ever shared before, and summarises my journey in (and out) of the world's most controversial 'religion'.

Support Brighthink: https://brighthink.org/
Read more: https://www.scientologybusiness.com

CHAPTERS
0:00 - Brighthinks
03:58 - Introduction
07:34 - Growing up
13:20 - Hope?
17:39 - John Sweeney & BBC Panorama
20:43 - Disconnection
24:27 - Promotion
26:24 - Guilt
27:20 - Leaving
34:18 - Activism
37:36 - Audience Q&A

episodes.title: Saint Hill Stories: The time has come to act. (Scientology: Behind Closed Doors Ep. 3)
episodes.description:
The time has come to act.  Episode 3: Inside Scientology's UK headquarters

Sign the petition: https://chng.it/FtSvKgHdzD

Watch Episode 2: https://youtu.be/7GXiR6Sp4nw
Watch Episode 1: https://youtu.be/BfWIBcWPGtw

In the UK, Scientology was rejected charity status in 1999 after it failed to provide sufficient evidence of its public benefit. Despite this, the world's most controversial religion has continued to tighten it's grip on society under a policy called  'safe pointing'.

The policy states Scientology's "viability depends on having all areas and persons who could affect or influence the operation under PR control" and directs a prolonged and relentless attempt to infiltrate local government and influence decision makers.

Since setting up shop at Saint Hill Manor the 1960s, Scientology 'safe pointing' has been in effect in and around East Grinstead for almost half a century, and it appears to be working.

In this hard hitting documentary, you will hear several personal stories of what really goes on behind closed doors at Scientology's UK headquarters.

Read more: https://www.scientologybusiness.com/featured/east-grinstead-mayor-defends-scientology-after-accepting-50000-charity-cheque/

episodes.title: Behind Closed Doors: What really goes on at Scientology's East Grinstead headquarters (Saint Hill)
episodes.description:
In the UK, Scientology was rejected charity status in 1999 after it failed to provide sufficient evidence of its public benefit. Despite this, the world's most controversial religion has continued to tighten it's grip on society under a policy known as 'Safe pointing'.

The policy states Scientology's "viability depends on having all areas and persons who could affect or influence the operation under PR control" and directs a prolonged and relentless attempt to infiltrate local government and influence decision makers.

Since setting up shop at Saint Hill Manor the 1960s, 'safe pointing' has been in effect in and around East Grinstead for almost half a century, and it appears to be working.

In this video, you will hear several personal stories of what really goes on behind closed doors at Scientology's UK headquarters.

episodes.title: Breaking Free: #Scientology Canada, The Untold Story (Part 1) - Recruitment and rising to the top
episodes.description:
After reaching her breaking point, Gabrielle Toth left her position as Executive Director of the Church of Scientology Vancouver and never looked back. Speaking out publicly for the first time, her story is a gripping account of heartbreak, disconnection and loss that sheds light on Scientology's inner workings from a unique, Canadian perspective.

Joining the group in 1988, Gabrielle recounts the 'Golden Age of Tech', David Miscavige's 9/11 wake up call and reveals the daily struggles she faced running a Scientology Class V Org. For over 20 years, every day was a scramble to survive. Now, she has taken back control of her life and shares her harrowing experiences in this raw and honest interview.

Subscribe to Gabrielle's NEW channel: https://youtube.com/@escapingthecultiverseeh
